a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Literacy rates, one-sentence test vs official estimate, 2018
The one-sentence test corresponds to data from DHS surveys. Specifically, the percentage of survey
respondents, aged 15 and above, who can read a whole or part of a sentence showed to them. The
official estimate corresponds to the UNESCO literacy rate. In most countries this correspond to the
percentage of people, aged 15 and above, who say they can read and write with understanding a short
simple statement about their everyday life.
Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above) - UNESCO
Literacy rate, adult total (% of total respondents) - DHS
Data source: DHS Surveys, UNESCO (via World Bank)
